text: Linda Thomas-Greenfield (born November 22, 1952) is an American diplomat. Thomas-Greenfield was the 31st United States Ambassador to the United Nations from February 25, 2021 until January 20, 2025. She was the Assistant Secretary of State for African Affairs in the United States Department of State's Bureau of African Affairs from 2013 to 2017. In November 2020, President Joe Biden announced his plans to nominate Thomas-Greenfield as the next United States Ambassador to the United Nations. She was confirmed by the United States Senate on February 23, 2021 by a 78 to 20 vote. ==References== Category:1952 births Category:Living people Category:African-American politicians Category:Politicians from Louisiana Category:United States Ambassadors to the United Nations Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians
